Press Releases.Title: 8 New Cases of Locally Transmitted Covid-19 Infection
Press Releases.MainContent:
As of 12 July 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 8 new cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection. 5 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 3 are currently unlinked.
 
2.      In addition, there are 18 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 13 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 5 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.
 
3.      In total, there are 26 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.
 
4.      We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.
 
 
MINISTRY OF HEALTH
12 JULY 2021
